description: When using a NamedTuple, an index error occurs when attempting to access an item in the tuple that is out of range. This error occurs when the index used to access the item is either negative or greater than the length of the tuple.
code:
from collections import namedtuple

# Create a named tuple
MyTuple = namedtuple('MyTuple', ['index_1', 'index_2', 'index_3'])

# Create an instance of MyTuple
tup = MyT
